content: iris please obey the copyright laws if you want to share please send them here thanks enjoy the pattern if you plan to make and sell these would you please attach a hang tag with j van wieren designer materials needed for one size 10 crochet hook size 30 crochet cotton or size 12 pearl cotton dmc flower thread or ginnie thompson flower thread works well too in white yellow and border color example is a light purple 6 cloth covered wire 18 lengths size 28 or 32 the smallest you can find or 4 strands of crochet cotton this will be referred to as popcorn in the directions won t hold as stiffly but a good option if you want it completely washable petal make 6 row 1 with yellow chain 21 turn row 2 single_crochet in 4th chain chain 3 single_crochet in next chain to end of beg chain fasten_off row 3 fold 1 wire or popcorn in half with white do a single_crochet start in same place as first stitch of row 2 and in between the wires of the doubled wire where you folded it single_crochet over wire and next chain to end chain 2 turn row 4 half_double_crochet in front lps only to end chain 3 half_double_crochet in bk lps to end chain 2 turn row 5 working in both lps half_double_crochet to chain 3 7 half_double_crochet in chain 3 mark 1st and last st half_double_crochet to end chain 2 turn row 6 half_double_crochet to mark 2 half_double_crochet in each st to next mark mark 1st and last st half_double_crochet to end chain 2 turn row 7 repeat row 6 row 8 *half_double_crochet in each stitch around fasten_off row 9 with border color use single_crochet start and chain 3 single_crochet in each st around leave a 5 to 6 in tail on each end weave tails to center and make sure each end goes around the wire from front to back and draw tight and tie off construction twist the wires of three petals together tightly making sure right sides are facing place each of the next three petals where they would overlap the opening of the center petals twist tightly open and curve 3 outer petals gently downward pull inner petals slightly outward and curve gently in copyright by jill van wieren 6/20/2000
